title: TraPole
author: TraPole
content: Hi, hadn't find here btcc discussion, who's trading here? pls share your opinion thanks

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Considering what their claim has been operated for 11 years old, but their trading volume is still untracked [1] and only 7 users are leave their reviews about this site in trustpilot, I don't find any discussion about this exchange. So I'm pretty sure it's just a new scum exchange that pretend to be an old exchange, old exchange surely will appear on the top 20 if they're still operated until now.Quote from: https://www.btcc.com/en-US11 years of securityProtecting users' assets through many market cycles with 0 security incidents since 2011.[1] https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/btcc/[2] https://www.trustpilot.com/review/btcc.com

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on January 17, 2023, 11:14:33 AMConsidering what their claim has been operated for 11 years old, but their trading volume is still untracked [1] and only 7 users are leave their reviews about this site in trustpilot, I don't find any discussion about this exchange. And their domain is registered since 1995.I have reason to avoid this based on archives of their site. Try to check the snapshots for 2018 or older, they are running a different service than they currently are. I don't think they really started 11 years ago.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: noorman0 on January 17, 2023, 12:48:59 PMAnd their domain is registered since 1995.I have reason to avoid this based on archives of their site. Try to check the snapshots for 2018 or older, they are running a different service than they currently are. I don't think they really started 11 years ago.It's very possible they bought the aged domain, so now they have some history. it doesn't have to be a mandatory sign for anything, good or risky side of the business.personally, I don't know anything about them, I may have seen their website somewhere, but not enough to have a clear opinion about them.I wouldn't use them or recommend them, but as far as I can see, something is happening there. They are highly ranked on CoinGecko as "Derivative Exchanges Ranked by Open Interest & Trade Volume". https://www.coingecko.com/en/exchanges/derivativesAlso, the web stats of their website says quite solid traffic sounds based on Taiwan. also, most of the traffic comes from those countries Taiwan, Korea, China, and Japan...Again, this is not my recommendation for using this exchange, just a short analysis of data from the internet.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: TraPole on January 16, 2023, 03:33:04 PMHi, hadn't find here btcc discussion, who's trading here? pls share your opinion To my knowledge they have a locked thread here: Topic: [ANN] Bitcoin Core [BTCC] | The return to the Core values of Bitcoin.  , unfortunately some negative feedback emerged.For example complaints by members below.Quote from: Z24 on May 18, 2019, 08:27:31 AMThe exchange hasnt sent out a official mail to the users but their site isnt opening. On checking their exchange telegram page it shows a screen that they are stopping operations.Tried contacting support but no response yet. Is there any admin for BTCC exchange here or can someone guide in the right direction?And also the responses you should see for clarity the representative of the BTCC exchange.Quote from: OmegaStarScream on May 18, 2019, 10:07:21 AMTheir representative here hasn't been active since November 2018. Their social media hasn't been active since January either.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=552507Elsewhere I also saw a new thread about 2022. Topic: BitcoinCopy ($BTCC) ICO - Bitcointalk Announcement, unfortunately also unclear information.Instead, you should consider not using the BTCC exchange, it seems dismal to trade on the BTCC exchange.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: With this limit, you pretty much need to KYC in most cases and if you're gonna do that, you might as well look for an exchange with a much better reputation.Quote from: https://www.btcc.com/en-US/support-center/detail/12316180743193The single withdrawal limit will be affected too. Users without completing KYC will be limited to withdraw not more than 50 USDT (or other equivalent amounts in USDC, BTC, ETH, XRP, ADA, or LTC) per withdrawal.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on January 17, 2023, 11:14:33 AMSo I'm pretty sure it's just a new scum exchange that pretend to be an old exchange, old exchange surely will appear on the top 20 if they're still operated until now.Oh really?https://cointelegraph.com/top-people-in-crypto-and-blockchain-2020/bobby-leeQuoteBobby Lee is the former CEO of China’s first cryptocurrency exchange, BTCC, founded in 2011Quote from: noorman0 on January 17, 2023, 12:48:59 PMI have reason to avoid this based on archives of their site. Try to check the snapshots for 2018 or older, they are running a different service than they currently are. I don't think they really started 11 years ago.Again, see the above link, BTCC was BTCChina at that time it's normal it looked different.Quote from: YOSHIE on January 19, 2023, 02:17:35 PMTo my knowledge they have a locked thread here: Topic: [ANN] Bitcoin Core [BTCC] | The return to the Core values of Bitcoin.  , unfortunately some negative feedback emerged.Elsewhere I also saw a new thread about 2022. Topic: BitcoinCopy ($BTCC) ICO - Bitcointalk Announcement, unfortunately also unclear information.So you just search for the term BTCC, didn't bother to read the topic to see if it's about some coin using the name of the exchange to gain attention, and decided it's about this exchange? You've been lately on a witchhunt that is starting to become a bit too much!Seriously, is Wikipedia good enough for you guys?https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BTCC_(company)

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: It is one of the oldest platforms that I heard, although I did not use it, but as far as I know, the platform has a lot of hidden fees, and therefore you will find that most of your profits have been lost because of these fees, which do not appear until you decide to click on the button (or after it, based on the fact that you will not read the conditions the service).In any case, there are many better services, so there is nothing to force you to use them.

comments.author: TraPole
comments.body: thanks for your replies, fellows! probably real btcc customers here?*looks not like a scumwondering about experience and your opinion. im binance user but would like to open an account on 2-3 more exchanges for hodl and payments

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: TraPole on February 01, 2023, 06:00:56 AMprobably real btcc customers here?Maybe the fact that you won't find any real BTCC users here speaks volumeQuote*looks not like a scumIt may not be a scam, but there could be a reason the exchange is not popular any more. Try to check out their withdrawal and trading fees compared to other popular exchanges. Minimum deposit and withdrawal limits and also read their TOS regarding KYC and the limits. It will help you make a guided decision.Quoteim binance user but would like to open an account on 2-3 more exchanges for hodl and paymentsHodling in an exchange is the last thing you should think about.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I've never heard of this exchange. It's new to me, so. I'm no longer interested in any new exchanges because of the recent drama surrounding centralized exchanges. To be honest I don't use any centralized exchange other than Binance. I used to use a few exchanges, but not any longer. I'm not interested in taking part in any drama. Even I have recently stopped keeping any funds for the exchange. Therefore, I won't try it.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on February 01, 2023, 12:42:28 PMMaybe the fact that you won't find any real BTCC users here speaks volumeIt may not be a scam, but there could be a reason the exchange is not popular any more. BTTC is a future derivatives exchange, not a spot exchange.I seriously can't believe what I'm defending here since I was one of the biggest haters of the former OKChina (now BTTC) and the gang like Huobi but just because the average Joe isn't using it it doesn't mean there is no usage. How many topics and how many users of CME you've seen a round? Does this make them irrelevant?If you're looking to trade BTC against Shiba of course BTTC is not the choice, if you want to push your luck and do a 150x leverage, yeah, 150x!!! then there are very few choices that have been around and still have some kind of reputation comparable to BTTC.Quote from: TraPole on February 01, 2023, 06:00:56 AMim binance user but would like to open an account on 2-3 more exchanges for hodl and paymentsIf you're looking for a hold, then you don't need an exchange at all, you need a cold wallet, storing your coins on an exchange is a big no!If you look for simple buy/sell options or sending coins to some partners then BTTC is not the best choice at all, as I said it's for pure mad leverage trading if you're not into this stick with the big spot exchanges!

comments.author: Minerall
comments.body: nice exchange, few year trading account here. if you are looking for the 2nd or 3d exchange - good choise

comments.author: TraPole
comments.body: Quote from: Minerall on February 02, 2023, 10:05:16 AMnice exchange, few year trading account here. if you are looking for the 2nd or 3d exchange - good choiseWithdrawals \ Payments ? Problems?

comments.author: btccexchange
comments.body: Hello everyone!BTCC was BTCChina before, but we've revamped our brand to reflect who we are. Please find more information here:https://www.cryptonewsz.com/btcc-unveils-new-logo-in-celebration-of11th-anniversary/Yes, we've been around in the crypto industry since 2011, and currently, we focus on providing crypto futures trading services.We support perpetual futures on 60+ trending cryptos, including BTC, ETH, DOGE, and many more. We also launched tokenized futures last year, allowing users to trade stocks and commodities using USDT.Follow our Twitter for more latest news: https://twitter.com/YourBTCC

comments.author: Redos
comments.body: is it possible to use external wallet to trade here? or i should upload my documents to trade ? tnx

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Quote from: btccexchange on February 13, 2023, 03:03:35 AMBTCC was BTCChina before, but we've revamped our brand to reflect who we are. Please find more information here:https://www.cryptonewsz.com/btcc-unveils-new-logo-in-celebration-of11th-anniversary/Yes, we've been around in the crypto industry since 2011, and currently, we focus on providing crypto futures trading services.It's good to see an exchange that's been in business since 2011 but it's strange at the same time that you're not widely known by traders.This is the largest crypto forum in the world though so few of the members here have heard of you!!! There are a lot of exchanges that appeared long after you, but they are very popular, so I am curious to know what are the reasons?

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: btccexchange on February 13, 2023, 03:03:35 AMHello everyone!BTCC was BTCChina before, but we've revamped our brand to reflect who we are. Does that mean it's under completely different management? I see that the official account associated with this exchange is BTCC_Official[1], so what happened to that account? It would be better if you open a new (single) announcement thread if planning to be a bit longer here.Quote from: yhiaali3 on February 18, 2023, 09:05:00 AMThis is the largest crypto forum in the world though so few of the members here have heard of you!!!I think they were here before and focused more on the collectibles business[2].1. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=552507

comments.author: Redos
comments.body: what about trading platform? any glitches?

comments.author: Minerall
comments.body: it's web based (smth like binance wich i also highly recommend), glitches: nope for now and for last few years.
